intro: Psychotria lolokiensis, commonly known as the Congo psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and West Africa, particularly found in the rainforests of the Congo Basin. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It is often found growing in shaded, humid environments, typically in the understorey of dense tropical forests. The plant is notable for its chemical composition, containing various alkaloids that have been studied for their potential pharmacological properties.
